text: Phillips State Prison is a Georgia Department of Corrections state medium- security prison for men located in Buford, Gwinnett County, Georgia. Current capacity of the facility is 918 inmates. Phillips was one of nine Georgia state prisons implicated in an FBI sting operation announced in February 2016. The agency indicted 47 correction officers who'd agreed to deliver illegal drugs while in uniform. These charges were "part of a larger public corruption investigation into Georgia Correctional Facilities". ==References== Category:Prisons in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Buildings and structures in Gwinnett County, Georgia Category:1990 establishments in Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Phillips State Prison
